page.title: 12CLUBS
page.content:
{Thornton Watlass Gardening Club}has been running for about eight years. About 65_70 people have joined it.It meets once a month in winter and twice a month in summer.
The aims of the club are to encourage people to show their produce, to keep gardens neat and to give the members an interest.
The gardening club doesn't involve children although they sometimes come to see what is happening.
In September there are things that do involve children in the show. They compete for small cash prizes by creating animals made from vegetables and by making miniature gardens. Every child who enters is given ten pence and the winners receive fifty pence.
